entries.title: Pinpoint: A research tool for journalists
entries.date: Product page; date not shown on snippet
entries.excerpt: “Turn audio and video recordings into searchable text files…”
entries.why_it_matters: Pinpoint is a newsroom-facing, searchable-corpus tool; good for grounding claims about large-scale document/audio search and collaboration.
entries.ai_extract: Google’s Pinpoint page lists core capabilities including searching large document sets, transcribing audio/video into searchable text with jump-to-audio, transforming tables into spreadsheets, and collaboration features.

entries.title: About Pinpoint (Help Center)
entries.date: Help article; date not shown on snippet
entries.excerpt: “Upload and search hundreds of thousands of documents… images… emails… and audio files…”
entries.why_it_matters: More “definitional” than the marketing page; useful for strict grounding of what Pinpoint is and what it supports.
entries.ai_extract: Google’s help article defines Pinpoint as a research tool for journalists and academics for exploring/analyzing large document collections, including images, emails, handwritten notes, and audio files, with sharing and annotation.

entries.title: Tips for Organizing Audio and Video Files and Making Them
entries.excerpt: “Upload a video or audio file, and the tool creates a PDF with a timestamped transcription…”
entries.why_it_matters: Practical workflow write-up that supports training material: what to do, what to expect, and limitations.
entries.ai_extract: GIJN explains a workflow for making interviews searchable and notes Pinpoint can transcribe uploaded audio/video and generate timestamped transcript PDFs; it also mentions limitations and compares to DocumentCloud for sharing.

entries.title: Getting started with Pinpoint, a research tool for journalists (training
entries.source: Google News Initiative (News on Air / with Google)
entries.date: Event page; date not shown on snippet
entries.why_it_matters: Training/onboarding reference for Pinpoint capabilities (useful for grounding a training module and linking to official learning material).
entries.ai_extract: A Google training/event page introducing Pinpoint and describing how it can help organize and transcribe materials, including mention of structured data extraction functionality.

entries.title: InVID Verification Plugin
entries.date: Tool page; date not shown on snippet
entries.excerpt: “Designed as a verification “Swiss army knife”… especially when verifying videos and images.”
entries.why_it_matters:
A foundational reference for video/image verification tooling in journalism and OSINT
workflows.
entries.ai_extract: The InVID project describes the InVID verification plugin as a toolbox to help journalists verify social content, emphasizing efficiency for fact-checking and debunking (noting some external services are not open-sourced).

entries.title: Verification plugin (InVID–WeVerify)
entries.date: Page mentions launch Sep 2021; last update date not fully specified
entries.excerpt: “More than 57k weekly active users… (according to Google Chrome statistics).”
entries.why_it_matters: Adds adoption signals (users) plus provenance (AFP Medialab + partners), useful for a grounded ‘why this tool matters’ entry.
entries.ai_extract: WeVerify describes the InVID–WeVerify browser extension, notes a 2021 redesign, references weekly active user counts, and states the toolkit is designed/maintained by AFP Medialab with support from scientific partners.

entries.title: Fake news debunker by InVID & WeVerify (Chrome Web Store listing)
entries.excerpt: “Designed as a verification “Swiss army knife”… especially when verifying videos and images.”
entries.why_it_matters: Concrete installable artifact + distribution channel; useful for “how to get it” and for verifiable adoption/updates via store metadata.
entries.ai_extract: The Chrome Web Store listing describes the InVID–WeVerify extension as a verification toolbox for journalists and fact-checkers and references its purpose for verifying videos/images; it also links to related project context.

entries.title: Google NotebookLM Help Center
entries.excerpt: “Official Help Center where you can find tips and tutorials…”
entries.why_it_matters: A stable grounding reference for how NotebookLM works and what it supports, especially when the marketing page is script-heavy.
entries.ai_extract: Google’s NotebookLM Help Center provides official guidance, FAQs, and troubleshooting for NotebookLM, suitable as a canonical reference in training materials.
